sentences: Johnny Costa (born John Costanza; January 18, 1922 – October 11, 1996) was an American jazz pianist.
Costa learned to play accordion at age seven and was reading music three years later.
On the day of his graduation, he began work as the house pianist for a radio station in Pittsburgh.
Costa's first recording was The Amazing Johnny Costa, a Savoy LP released in 1955 and reissued on CD as Neighborhood in 1989.
Costa's first recording was The Amazing Johnny Costa, a Savoy LP released in 1955 and reissued on CD as Neighborhood in 1989.
Costa appeared along with guitarist Joe Negri on the 1954 Ken Griffin TV series 67 Melody Lane.
Costa served as musical director, arranger, and keyboardist for the children's television series Mister Rogers' Neighborhood from the program's debut in 1968 until his death in 1996.
Costa served as musical director, arranger, and keyboardist for the children's television series Mister Rogers' Neighborhood from the program's debut in 1968 until his death in 1996.
Each day, Costa and his trio (Carl McVicker Jr. on bass, Bobby Rawsthorne on percussion) played live in the studio for the filming.
After his death, Michael Moricz took over as musical director on Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood until the show ended in 2001.
